invented_from_concepts.description: Words directly formed by abstracting or combining concepts.

invented_from_metaphors_or_analogies.description: Words derived through metaphorical extension or analogical reasoning from concepts.

invented_from_experiential_or_perceptual.description: Words formed based on sensory, embodied, or experiential aspects related to concepts.

invented_from_functional_or_relational_p.description: Words derived from the functions, roles, or relationships associated with concepts.

invented_from_ontological_or_metaphysica.description: Words arising from underlying assumptions about existence, reality, or being.

linguistic_mechanisms.description: Specific linguistic processes used in invention (e.g., compounding, affixation, blending).

conceptual_to_lexical_mapping.description: How abstract concepts are translated into word forms.

language_and_thought.description: The influence of invented words on conceptualization and understanding.

ontological_status_of_invented_words.description: Whether invented words represent new entities, concepts, or simply new labels.

unexplored_categories.description: Potential categories of word invention not covered.

testable_predictions.description: Predictions about future word invention based on conceptual shifts.
